hints.content: First, consider how to calculate the sum of the array. You will need this sum to determine if it is divisible by k. Use a simple loop to sum the elements of the array.
Next, think about what it means for a number to be divisible by k. A number is divisible by k if the remainder when divided by k is zero. You can use the modulo operator to check this.
Once you have the sum, calculate the remainder when the sum is divided by k. This will help you understand how far the sum is from being divisible by k.
If the remainder is zero, you don't need to perform any operations. Can you think of how to check this condition early in your solution?
If the remainder is not zero, you need to reduce the sum to make it divisible by k. Think about how many operations you need to perform to achieve this.
To make the sum divisible by k, you can reduce the sum by the remainder itself. This means you will need to perform a number of operations equal to the remainder.
Consider the case where the remainder is greater than the smallest element in the array. In this situation, you might need to perform operations on multiple elements to reach the desired sum.
If you need to reduce the sum by more than the smallest element, you may have to perform operations on multiple indices. Think about how you can distribute the operations across the array.
Remember to keep track of the total number of operations performed. You can use a counter to accumulate the number of operations as you adjust the elements in the array.
Finally, make sure to return the total number of operations needed. Your function should return this value once you have adjusted the array to meet the divisibility condition.

questionNotes: The sum of the array must be made divisible by k by only decrementing elements.
